definition: older brother's wife/sister-in-law/elder sister (respectful appellation for an older married woman)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Eldest sister-in-law said she does not, during filming, I think is good.
sentences.chinese: 大嫂說她拍攝不上照，我看還不錯。

sentences.english: Luo Daquan should execute Mrs Chen, be held off by old sister-in-law however.
sentences.chinese: 羅大全要處決陳太太，卻被陳大嫂擋住。

sentences.english: He raised spear, aim at old sister-in-law, put down again.
sentences.chinese: 他舉起了長槍，瞄準陳大嫂，又放下。

sentences.english: You have two beautiful children there, Madame.
sentences.chinese: 大嫂，您的兩個小寶寶真可愛。

sentences.english: Be in barren mountain, old sister-in-law and Luo Daquan vertical horse gallop, shoot hunt.
sentences.chinese: 在荒山，陳大嫂和羅大全縱馬飛奔，開槍打獵。

sentences.english: Sister, here is ten yuan. I know you need money badly. Please take it.
sentences.chinese: 大嫂，這是十元錢，你急需，先拿去吧。

sentences.english: Many around the woman, all Aunt Daisow.
sentences.chinese: 周圍女人不少，全是大姑大嫂。

sentences.english: Aunt Li came forward, extending her hand.
sentences.chinese: 李大嫂伸出手走向前來。

sentences.english: In critical juncture, luo Daquan professions to old sister-in-law eventually.
sentences.chinese: 在一次危急關頭，羅大全終於向陳大嫂表白。

sentences.english: He is going to move out, do not always say uncle sister-in-law, the family man.
sentences.chinese: 他要搬出去住，大嫂不依，說二叔永遠是這個家的人。

definition: big sister/elder sister/older sister (also polite term of address for a girl or woman slightly older than the speaker)
older brother's wife/sister-in-law/(polite address to a younger married woman) sister
eldest brother/big brother (polite address for a man of about the same age as oneself)/gang leader/boss
daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
wife of older male cousin via female line
older male cousin via female line
